intro: Linaria spuria f. minoripes, commonly known as the lesser spurge. This plant is a flowering species belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while the flowers have two lips, typical of the genus Linaria. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
